title: The future of menus includes upcycled ingredients - Food Business News
summary: The Spare Food Co. has developed a new ingredient called Spare Starter, made from surplus vegetables, to help restaurants reduce food waste and incorporate more plant-based options into their menus. The product, a blend of six vegetables and spices, is made from parts of vegetables that are typically discarded, and it can be used in various dishes, from ravioli fillings to burgers. By using Spare Starter, restaurants can contribute to a more sustainable food system and appeal to environmentally conscious consumers.

title: How Progressive Grocer's Impact Awards Winners Are Improving the World - Progressive Grocer
summary: ALDI, a grocery retailer, partners with Alex's Lemonade Stand Foundation (ALSF) to raise funds for childhood cancer research. ALDI sells lemonade stand kits, offers ALSF-branded bags of lemons with a portion of the proceeds going to ALSF, and matches employee donations to the ALDI Heroes Fund. This initiative has raised millions of dollars for ALSF, demonstrating ALDI's commitment to supporting the fight against childhood cancer.
product_or_process: in-store and online campaign with unique ALDI Finds product offerings

title: PepsiCo Announces Agriculture Accelerator Projects to Support Farmer Livelihoods, Scale Sustainable Innovation and ... - PR Newswire
summary: PepsiCo's Positive Agriculture Outcomes (PAO) Accelerator is investing over $30 million in 40 agricultural projects by 2028.  The program supports innovations aimed at climate resilience, soil health, and water efficiency across nine countries.  PepsiCo aims to achieve regenerative farming practices on 7 million acres by 2030 through this initiative.

title: The Coca-Cola Company Comments on Tax Court Decision - Yahoo Finance Australia
summary: The Coca-Cola Company is disputing a recent U.S. Tax Court decision regarding its tax liability. The company claims the IRS is using a calculation methodology that is unconstitutional and different from what was previously agreed upon. This dispute will not affect the company's tax reserve or its overall effective tax rate.

title: ofi officially opens state-of-the-art dairy processing plant in New Zealand - Food and Drink Technology
summary: Ofi, a global food ingredients company, has opened a new dairy processing plant in New Zealand's Waikato region, designed to produce dairy ingredients for key customers in the dessert, bakery, beverage, and confectionery sectors. The facility complements ofi's existing global footprint and enhances its co-creation capabilities, while also focusing on sustainability by providing support to farmer partners to meet their social and environmental goals by 2030.

title: Mavala's ultimate guide to beauty features skincare-infused make-up range - Global Travel Retail Magazine
summary: Mavala, a Swiss beauty brand, has launched a new skincare-infused makeup line with a focus on natural ingredients and environmental responsibility. This line includes Serum Foundation, Perfect Concealer, and Magic Powder, all designed to improve skin quality and appearance. Mavala emphasizes education about healthy skin and nail care, providing information and resources for consumers.

title: Olam Food Ingredients opens New Zealand dairy processing plant - FoodManufacture.co.uk
summary: ofi, a global ingredients company, opened a new dairy ingredients plant in Tokoroa, New Zealand. The plant will supply markets across Southeast Asia, China, the Middle East, and Africa. ofi aims to expand its offering, create new high-value dairy ingredients, and deliver better returns to its partner farmers while producing ingredients in a socially responsible and environmentally sustainable manner.

title: Brand Studio Lifestyle Witnesses Record Sales in a Single Month, up a massive 132 pc YoY - Indian Retailer
summary: The article discusses the top 10 luxury watch brands in India, highlighting their historical significance, innovative designs, and craftsmanship. It provides insights into the features, innovations, and brand heritage of these companies, including Rolex, Franck Muller, Omega, Breguet, TAG Heuer, Hublot, Breitling, Chopard, Longines, and Bell & Ross. title: Top 10 Best Paper Manufacturing Companies In India 2024 - Inventiva
summary: India's paper manufacturing industry is experiencing growth fueled by rising demand and a focus on sustainability. Top companies like ITC PSPD, Ballarpur Industries Limited, and JK Paper Limited are leading the way with advanced manufacturing, eco-friendly practices, and digital transformation. These companies are driving both economic development and environmental preservation in the sector.
